oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Rain follows death. The method of protecting the grave. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-28. 8465-8467). When a person dies the rain falls, washing away their footprints ('a person who rains'). The people cover the grave with bushes, after which they heap stones 'nicely' on top of the bushes to cover them. 1) p.8464v: |han=kass'o observed this himself; the dead person is called the 'person who rains', 2) This story is found in Book VIII-28.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rain washes out a dead man's footsteps
